definition: right under one's nose/right in front of one's eyes/close at hand/imminent
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: As the church came into view, Katharine could see the crowds.
sentences.chinese: 當教堂近在眼前，凱瑟琳能夠看見人羣。

sentences.english: Actually, the whole D-Day operation was just round the corner.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，整個登陸行動已近在眼前。

sentences.english: Three quick implications of this are worth paying attention to.
sentences.chinese: 有三種近在眼前的潛在影響值得關注。

sentences.english: For the Last Judgment draweth nigh.
But that didn`t mean the other world of the concentration camps felt any closer.
sentences.chinese: 但這並不意味着集中營的另一個世界就近在眼前。

sentences.english: The end –of-term exam is at hand.
They are so far and yet so near.
But one of the readiest sources of skilled labour is closer to hand.
sentences.chinese: 但最現成的技術工人則近在眼前。

sentences.english: My point is that the cyborg future is here.
sentences.chinese: 我想說的是半電腦人的未來近在眼前。

sentences.english: And meanwhile the quite obvious cause of vagrancy is staring one in the face.
sentences.chinese: 同時，流浪的十分明顯的理由卻近在眼前。

definition: to be almost within reach/to be close at hand
unattainable/far-fetched/out of reach/exceedingly remote or distant
far in the indefinite future (idiom); so far away it seems forever
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
to be about to arrive/to be around the corner
